Title: Verify Patient Registration
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully register on the application.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with valid details (e.g., name, email, password). 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form.
Result: The patient should be successfully registered and redirected to the login page.

Title: Verify Doctor Search Functionality
Description: Verify that a patient can search for a doctor's information.
Precondition: The patient is logged into the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the doctor search page. 2. Enter a valid doctor's name in the search field. 3. Submit the search query.
Action: Submit the search query.
Result: The system should display the doctor's information.

Title: Verify Appointment Booking
Description: Verify that a patient can book an appointment with a diagnostic center.
Precondition: The patient is logged into the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the appointment booking page. 2. Select a diagnostic center. 3. Choose a specific time slot. 4. Submit the appointment request.
Action: Submit the appointment request.
Data: Valid diagnostic center and time slot details
Result: The system should confirm the appointment and calculate the waiting time.

Title: Verify Invalid Login Attempt
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid login attempts gracefully.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and/or password. 3. Submit the login form.
Action: Submit the login form with invalid credentials.
Result: The system should display an error message indicating invalid credentials.

Title: Verify Boundary Value for Password Length
Description: Verify that the system enforces password length requirements.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with a password that is exactly at the minimum length boundary. 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form with a boundary value password.
Data: Password at the minimum length boundary
Result: The system should accept the password and register the user successfully.

Title: Verify System Response Time Under Load
Description: Ensure the application maintains acceptable response times under high user load.
Precondition: The application is deployed in a staging environment with load testing tools configured.
Steps: 1. Simulate 1000 concurrent users accessing the application. 2. Monitor the response time for key functionalities such as login, appointment booking, and report viewing. 3. Record the average response time and any timeouts or errors.
Action: Simulate high user load and monitor response times.
Result: The average response time should be within acceptable limits (e.g., less than 3 seconds) with no timeouts or errors.

Title: Test Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Validate that users can only access functionalities permitted by their roles.
Precondition: User accounts for Patient, Doctor, and Diagnostic Center are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Doctor and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 2. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Patient and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 3. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Patient and Doctor functionalities. 4. Verify that access is denied for unauthorized functionalities.
Action: Attempt to access unauthorized functionalities for each user role.
Data: User credentials for Patient, Doctor, and Diagnostic Center
Result: Access should be denied for unauthorized functionalities for each user role.

Title: Verify Data Integrity During Concurrent Access
Description: Ensure data integrity when multiple users access and modify the same data simultaneously.
Precondition: Multiple user accounts are created and logged in.
Steps: 1. User A and User B attempt to book the same appointment slot simultaneously. 2. Monitor the system to ensure that only one booking is successful and the other is rejected. 3. Verify that the appointment details are accurately reflected in the system.
Action: Simulate concurrent access and modification of the same data.
Result: Only one booking should be successful, and the system should accurately reflect the appointment details.

Title: Test System Recovery After Failure
Description: Assess the system's ability to recover from a failure and resume normal operation.
Precondition: The application is running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Simulate a system failure by stopping the application server. 2. Restart the application server and monitor the recovery process. 3. Verify that the system resumes normal operation and that all data is intact.
Action: Simulate a system failure and monitor recovery.
Result: The system should resume normal operation within the specified mean time to recovery, and all data should be intact.

Title: Verify Data Security During Transmission
Description: Ensure that patient data is securely transmitted and not accessible to unauthorized users.
Precondition: The application is deployed in a staging environment with network monitoring tools configured.
Steps: 1. Capture network traffic while a user logs in and accesses their data. 2. Analyze the captured traffic to ensure that data is encrypted. 3. Attempt to access the captured data using unauthorized credentials.
Action: Capture and analyze network traffic.
Result: The data should be encrypted during transmission, and unauthorized access attempts should be denied.

Title: Verify Patient Login with Valid Credentials
Description: Ensure that a patient can successfully log in with valid username and password.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a valid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Login with valid credentials
Result: The patient should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Title: Attempt Patient Login with Invalid Credentials
Description: Ensure that a patient cannot log in with invalid username and password.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Login with invalid credentials
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: SQL Injection Attempt in Patient Login
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to SQL injection attacks during the login process.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with SQL injection payload (e.g., ' OR '1'='1). 3. Enter any password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Attempt SQL injection
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Verify Doctor Access to Patient Reports
Description: Ensure that a doctor can access patient reports with the appropriate permissions.
Precondition: Doctor is logged in with valid credentials.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the patient reports section. 2. Search for a specific patient. 3. Attempt to view the patient's reports.
Action: Access patient reports
Result: The doctor should be able to view the patient's reports.

Title: Attempt Unauthorized Access to Patient Reports by Diagnostic Center
Description: Ensure that a diagnostic center cannot access patient reports without the appropriate permissions.
Precondition: Diagnostic center is logged in with valid credentials.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the patient reports section. 2. Search for a specific patient. 3. Attempt to view the patient's reports.
Action: Attempt unauthorized access to patient reports
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent access to the patient's reports.

Title: Load Test for Patient Registration
Description: Simulate multiple patients registering simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 100 concurrent users accessing the registration page. 2. Each user fills out the registration form with unique data. 3. All users submit the registration form simultaneously.
Action: Simulate 100 concurrent users registering.
Data: Unique registration data for each user.
Result: All users should be able to register successfully within an acceptable response time (e.g., < 5 seconds).

Title: Stress Test for Doctor Appointment Booking
Description: Push the system to its limits by simulating a high number of concurrent appointment bookings.
Precondition: The application is up and running, and there are available appointment slots.
Steps: 1. Simulate 500 concurrent users trying to book appointments. 2. Each user searches for available appointment slots. 3. All users attempt to book an appointment simultaneously.
Action: Simulate 500 concurrent users booking appointments.
Result: The system should handle the load without crashing, but response times may increase. Identify the breaking point.

Title: Endurance Test for Diagnostic Center Report Upload
Description: Evaluate the system's ability to sustain a prolonged load of report uploads by diagnostic centers.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 50 concurrent diagnostic centers uploading reports continuously for 24 hours. 2. Each center uploads a report every minute.
Action: Simulate continuous report uploads for 24 hours.
Result: The system should sustain the load without significant degradation in performance.

Title: Scalability Test for Patient Report Access
Description: Determine the system's ability to handle an increasing number of patients accessing their reports.
Precondition: The application is up and running, and there are reports available for patients.
Steps: 1. Start with 100 concurrent users accessing their reports. 2. Gradually increase the number of concurrent users by 100 every 5 minutes up to 1000 users. 3. Monitor the system's response time and resource utilization.
Action: Gradually increase the number of concurrent users accessing reports.
Result: The system should handle the increasing load with acceptable response times and resource utilization.

Title: Load Test for Doctor Login
Description: Simulate multiple doctors logging in simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 200 concurrent doctors logging into the application. 2. Each doctor enters their unique username and password. 3. All doctors log in simultaneously.
Action: Simulate 200 concurrent doctors logging in.
Data: Unique username and password for each doctor.
Result: All doctors should be able to log in successfully within an acceptable response time (e.g., < 3 seconds).

Title: Verify Minimum Password Length
Description: Test the system's behavior when the password is exactly at the minimum length boundary.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login/sign-up page. 2. Enter a username. 3. Enter a password with the minimum allowed length (assuming the minimum length is 8 characters, e.g., "password"). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with the minimum allowed length and submit the form.
Result: The system should accept the password and allow the user to proceed.

Title: Verify Maximum Password Length
Description: Test the system's behavior when the password is exactly at the maximum length boundary.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login/sign-up page. 2. Enter a username. 3. Enter a password with the maximum allowed length (assuming the maximum length is 20 characters, e.g., "password123456789012345"). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with the maximum allowed length and submit the form.
Result: The system should accept the password and allow the user to proceed.

Title: Verify Password Length Just Below Minimum
Description: Test the system's behavior when the password is just below the minimum length boundary.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login/sign-up page. 2. Enter a username. 3. Enter a password with a length just below the minimum allowed length (assuming the minimum length is 8 characters, e.g., "passwor"). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with a length just below the minimum allowed length and submit the form.
Result: The system should reject the password and display an error message.

Title: Verify Password Length Just Above Maximum
Description: Test the system's behavior when the password is just above the maximum length boundary.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login/sign-up page. 2. Enter a username. 3. Enter a password with a length just above the maximum allowed length (assuming the maximum length is 20 characters, e.g., "password1234567890123456"). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with a length just above the maximum allowed length and submit the form.
Result: The system should reject the password and display an error message.

Title: Verify Invalid Password Format
Description: Test the system's behavior when the password is completely invalid (e.g., no special characters where required).
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login/sign-up page. 2. Enter a username. 3. Enter a password that does not meet the required format (e.g., "password" without any special characters). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter an invalid password format and submit the form.
Result: The system should reject the password and display an error message.

Title: Verify Password Requirements
Description: Ensure that the system enforces password requirements such as length, special characters, expiry, and recycling policies.
Precondition: User is on the registration or login page.
Steps: 1. Attempt to create a new user account with a password that does not meet the required criteria (e.g., less than 8 characters, no special characters). 2. Attempt to create a new user account with a password that meets the required criteria. 3. Attempt to change an existing password to one that does not meet the required criteria. 4. Attempt to change an existing password to one that meets the required criteria.
Action: Create and change user passwords.
Data: Various password strings that meet and do not meet the required criteria.
Result: The system should prevent the creation or change of passwords that do not meet the required criteria and allow those that do.

Title: Verify Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Ensure that the system enforces access control based on user roles (Patient, Doctor, Diagnostic Center).
Precondition: Users are logged into the system with different roles.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Doctor-specific functionalities. 2. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Diagnostic Center-specific functionalities. 3. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Patient-specific functionalities. 4. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Patient-specific functionalities. 5. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Doctor-specific functionalities. 6. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Diagnostic Center-specific functionalities.
Action: Attempt to access different functionalities based on user roles.
Result: The system should allow access to functionalities based on the user's role and deny access to functionalities that are not permitted for that role.

Title: Verify Data Classification and Protection
Description: Ensure that all data is protectively marked, stored, and protected according to relevant regulations.
Precondition: The system is operational and data is being stored and accessed.
Steps: 1. Attempt to access patient data without proper authorization. 2. Verify that patient data is stored with appropriate encryption and access controls. 3. Verify that diagnostic reports are only accessible to authorized users. 4. Verify that data is backed up and can be recovered in case of failure.
Action: Attempt to access and verify the storage and protection of patient data.
Result: The system should prevent unauthorized access to patient data, ensure data is stored securely, and allow authorized users to access the data.

Title: Verify System Availability
Description: Ensure that the system is available 24/7 and that patients can access their reports at any time.
Precondition: The system is operational.
Steps: 1. Attempt to access the system at various times throughout the day and night. 2. Attempt to access patient reports at various times throughout the day and night. 3. Simulate a system failure and verify the mean time to recovery.
Action: Access the system and patient reports at different times and simulate a system failure.
Result: The system should be accessible 24/7, and patients should be able to access their reports at any time. The system should recover quickly from failures.

Title: Verify Data Integrity and Accuracy
Description: Ensure that the data maintained by the software system is accurate, authentic, and without corruption.
Precondition: The system is operational and data is being processed.
Steps: 1. Verify that patient reports are processed accurately and without errors. 2. Verify that any changes in the database are reflected accurately across the system. 3. Simulate incorrect data entry and verify that the system flags or prevents the entry of incorrect data.
Action: Process patient reports, verify database changes, and simulate incorrect data entry.
Result: The system should process patient reports accurately, reflect database changes correctly, and flag or prevent the entry of incorrect data.
